What are the main advantages of nanobodi: Their small size, stability, and specific binding ability to antigens.
Their ability to induce a strong immune response and long half-life in the bloodstream.
Their high production yield in mammalian cell cultures and ease of purification.
Their ability to cross the blood-brain barrier and target neurological tissues.
What future refinement did the study sug: Incorporating entropy calculations in MD simulations for more accurate ΔΔG predictions.
Using larger datasets for training machine learning models.
Increasing the number of experimental validation steps.
Developing new nanobody scaffolds with enhanced solubility.
What was identified as a challenge in th: The lack of stability prediction and limitations of ML methods in predicting binding affinity.
The high cost and time consumption of molecular dynamics simulations.
The inability to produce nanobodies in bacterial expression systems.
The difficulty in obtaining high-resolution crystal structures of nanobody-antigen complexes.
